intro: Normeyera atrimontis, commonly known as the Montane Narrowleaf Plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, elongated leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Normeyera atrimontis is considered a species of conservation concern.
